intro: Hebecocca panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian hebecocca, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while the flowers range in color from pink to white. Hebecocca panamensis is often found in moist, tropical environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
